title: Industrial Revolution and Immigration

vocab.definition: A time when machines began doing work that people used to do by hand
Moving from one country to live permanently in another country
A building where workers use machines to make goods
An island near New York where immigrants were processed entering America
The growth of cities as people move from farms to urban areas

teachingNotes: Connect how new machines changed work and brought people to cities. Discuss why people immigrated and their contributions to America.

sample.question: What do we call the time when machines began replacing hand work?

truefalse.question: Ellis Island was where many immigrants first arrived in America.

multiplechoice.question: What happened to cities during the Industrial Revolution?

fillintheblank.question: Moving from one country to live in another is called ________.

shortanswer.question: Why did many people move from farms to cities during the Industrial Revolution?
